notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow an attacker to gain administrative access to DeltaV Smart Switches.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE SECTORS: Chemical, Critical Manufacturing, Energy

notes.text: NCCIC recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
NCCIC also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS-CERT website in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to NCCIC for tracking and correlation against other incidents.

notes.text: The Smart Switch Command Center does not change the DeltaV Smart Switch management account password upon commissioning as expected, leaving the default password in effect indefinitely.CVE-2018-11691 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 6.1 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:A/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Emerson recommends users patch affected products. Details are available within article DSN19003 (KBA# NK-1900-0808). Software patches and DSN19003 are available to users with access to the Emerson Guardian Support Portal at the following link:

To limit exposure to these and other vulnerabilities, Emerson recommends that DeltaV systems and related components be deployed and configured as described in the DeltaV security manual, which can be found in Emerson’s Guardian Support Portal.
